page.title: 17Secondary Schools in Rugeley
page.content: {Hagley Park Comprehensive} was opened in 1956 as a result of the influx of miners from the North-East to work in the new Lea Hall Colliery. The school is close to the Pear Tree Estate where many miners and their families live. {Fair Oak Comprehensive} was opened in 1967 as a purpose-built comprehensive school on the closure of Rugeley Grammar School and the changing of education in Rugeley to the comprehensive system. Further buildings were added in 1974 and 1976. At present Hagley Park and Fair Oak teach pupils aged 11-18 years. Both schools will cease to exist in July 1986. They will re-open under new names, with more pupils and an age range of 11-16 years, as 3 local schools are being merged into 2. There will be a separate 6th form centre.
